column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=Polycrystalline samples of the SmFe(As,P)O system were synthesized at ambient pressure (AP) in evacuated quartz ampoules and under high pressure (HP).

#Text=Powders of SmAs, SmP, Fe2O3, and Fe of high purity (≥ 99.95%) were weighed according to the stoichiometric ratio, thoroughly ground, and pressed into pellets that were then placed into alumina crucibles with cups.
#Text=The crucibles were loaded to the quartz ampoules, evacuated, filled with Ar gas (∼ 0.2 atm.) and sealed.
#Text=The ampoules were slowly heated to 660 °C where the temperature was maintained for 3 h.
#Text=Then the temperature was raised to 1060 °C and maintained for 100 h, and subsequently the ampoules were quenched in cold water.
#Text=For the high pressure synthesis we used the same starting materials.
#Text=The mixed multiple variants of the synthesis were used as well.
#Text=In order to recognize the samples synthesized in various conditions we introduced abbreviation codes describing the sequence of synthesis.

#Text=For example, the abbreviation HP+AP+HP means that the sample which was initially synthesized under high pressure (HP), was resynthesized at ambient pressure (AP), and then once more synthesized under high pressure (HP).
#Text=For the growth of single crystals a NaCl/KCl flux was mixed with an equal amount of the precursor (for details see Refs. [14, 15]).
#Text=All procedures related with the sample preparation were performed in a glove box due to the toxicity of arsenic.
#Text=In HP synthesis the sample was enclosed in a boron nitride container and placed inside a graphite heater.
#Text=In a typical run, a pressure of 3 GPa was applied at room temperature.
#Text=While keeping the pressure constant, the temperature was ramped up in 1 h to the maximum value of ∼ 1350 °C, maintained for 4.5 h, followed by quenching.
#Text=For the crystal growth the maximum temperature was maintained for 72 h, and then decreased to room temperature in 2 h.
#Text=Afterwards the pressure was released and the sample removed.
#Text=The NaCl/KCl flux was dissolved in water.
